forecasts.statement: Cloudy at times. Chance of a shower in Upper Hutt. Strong northwesterlies, gale at times, easing this evening.
Cloudy to start, then becoming fine. Light winds and afternoon southeast breezes.
Fine, but a few afternoon and evening clouds. Light winds, but southerly breezes in the afternoon.

information.text: High: Forecast for the calendar day. Usually occurs in the afternoon.
Low: Forecast between noon on the calendar day and noon the following day.  Usually occurs around dawn.
Forecast times: Overnight: Midnight - 6am, Morning: 6am - Noon, Afternoon: Noon - 6pm, Evening: 6pm - Midnight.

content.heading: Main
content.text: Autumn brings a change in both weather and the pests and diseases that affect people in the their homes and gardens. Numbers of insect pests decline, but rodents begin to seek shelter and alternative food sources in homes, while weeds grow actively in gardens and lawns. Kiwicare will help you identify the pests and find solutions. For further advice, visit Kiwicare.co.nz or download the MyKiwicare app.

content.heading: Veges
content.text: Get rid of weeds in your vegetable patch and start sowing your winter vegetables; broad beans, beetroot, celery,  cabbage, carrots, cauliflower, spinach, onions, lettuce, garlic, leeks, parsnips, peas, turnips, parsnips and parsley.

content.heading: Flowers
content.text: Remove the dead and dying leaves and collapsed stems of herbaceous perennials. Leave any stems that have attractive seed heads for birds to feed on. Remove weeds, then spread compost or well-rotted manure on top of the soil to insulate plant roots – the earthworms will work it into the soil over winter. Plant your spring flowering bulbs as soon as the weather cools.

content.heading: Fruits
content.text: Lift any fallen fruit and keep areas under fruit trees and vines clear, to reduce the risk of pests and diseases lurking in the soil over winter.  When in dormancy your fruit trees should be given their winter spray programme to clean away pest eggs and disease spores. See the Winter Spay Programme on Kiwicare.co.nz

content.heading: Pests
content.text: As the weather cools and natural food sources dwindle, rats and mice seek food and shelter in homes and other buildings. Check around your home for places rodents might gain entry and seal the entry points. If rodents gain entry, or you find evidence around your house, go to Kiwicare.co.nz to find information on how to safely and effectively protect your family from rats and mice.

content.heading: Lawn
content.text: Autumn is a great time to get rid of weeds in your lawn, and to sow new lawns or to thicken up existing lawns by over-sowing and fertilising. Use the Kiwicare Problem Solver on the Kiwicare website or MyKiwicare App to identify your lawn weeds, get advice on how to get rid of them, and prepare your lawn for winter.

tabs.description: Rank of the locations with the highest air temperature recorded yesterday. Prev is the previous day's rank for the location. The arrow shows if the current rank is higher or lower than that for the previous day. Max of 5 locations plus current town/city shown.
tabs.name: Hottest

tabs.description: Rank of the locations with the lowest air temperature recorded yesterday. Prev is the previous day's rank for the location. The arrow shows if the current rank is higher or lower than that for the previous day. Max of 5 locations plus current town/city shown
tabs.name: Coldest

tabs.description: Rank of the locations with the most rainfall recorded yesterday. Prev is the previous day's rank for the location. The arrow shows if the current rank is higher or lower than that for the previous day. Max of 5 locations plus current town/city shown.
tabs.name: Wettest

tabs.description: Rank of the locations with the strongest wind gust recorded yesterday. Prev is the previous day's rank for the location. The arrow shows if the current rank is higher or lower than that for the previous day. Max of 5 locations plus current town/city shown.
tabs.name: Windiest

modules.content:
Calm after the storm for Easter Weekend
Issued: 12:17pm Thursday 1 Apr 2021
After a soggy and thundery week for many, MetService forecasts relatively settled weather for Easter weekend...
